subtitle: [Music]
New Thinking Allowed. Conversations on the
leading edge
of knowledge and discovery with
parapsychologist
Jeffrey Mishlove.
Hello and welcome. I’m Jeffrey Mishlove.
I’m going to talk today a little bit
more about unidentified aerial
phenomenon, or
UFOs or UAPs.
The day before I release this
“In Presence” monologue I
will have released the interview with
Leslie Kean, the investigative journalist
who has been publishing
articles in The New York Times about
UFOs -
the most recent revelations
concerning
possible retrieved materials from UFO
crash sites.
I do have a bit of additional
information
to update you regarding UFOs. If
you have an interest in UFOs keep
viewing
this monologue. Let me
begin by referring back to my
mentor Arthur M.
Young who is the founder of the
Institute for the Study of
Consciousness in Berkeley where I had
the great privilege
to live there with Arthur Young back in
1973 and 1974, as I recall.
He was, as I mentioned the inventor of
the Bell Helicopter, the first
commercially licensed helicopter, the one
with the little bubble and
skids. I remember
vividly him saying - of course, he was my
age when I knew him then, he was in
his 70s, I was in my 20s -
but he said to me, if he could start all
over again
what he would most like to do with his
life was to build a UFO,
to invent what we think of today
as UFOs. He was an inventor.
He worked for decades
on the helicopter. It didn’t come to him
{merge/delete}
like Tesla’s inventions that I’ve
referred to in previous monologues
or the inventions of Buck Charlson,
fully formed
in his mind so that it worked the first
time. He
experimented and experimented on faulty
designs
until he finally, through dogged
persistence got the correct design
for the helicopter rotor system.
Now, I’m also going to link to an earlier
“In Presence” monologue
featuring my discussions of Jack Sarfatti.
I think the title of that monologue is
something like
“Conscious Computers Aboard a UFO.”
Indeed, that’s what Sarfatti
himself is
claiming. That monologue
will be very interesting to you if
you haven’t been following
these discussions. It will sort of bring
you up to date quite a bit
in terms of where we are because it was
made in 2018,
and it seems as if a crucial year
regarding revelations
concerning UFOs was 2017.
That’s the year that we finally learned
about the
sightings going back to 2004.
The Nimitz Aircraft Carrier Group
off the coast of California where
they had many videos
and radar tracings of unidentified
aerial objects
and eyewitness reports showing that
they had capabilities vastly in excess
of anything available to the U.S. Navy
at least. Who knows? Maybe the Air Force
was experimenting. There has been some
suggestion of that. But that’s also the same
year that the Administrator of
NASA, Charles Bolden, who is also an
astronaut, was put on a six months
sick leave because he made the claim,
the astonishing claim, that we are about
to be invaded by
aliens from outer space. He said that
invasion is almost certainly going to
occur by the year 2025.
After that he was sent out on sick leave and
NASA announced that even though he was
the top guy, the NASA
Administrator, that his opinion did not
represent the opinions of
NASA. For all I know they do
represent the opinions of my friend Jack
Sarfatti.
Jack subsequently has gotten
very involved in analyzing the
video tapes and the eyewitness reports
from that Nimitz
Carrier Group sighting going back to 2004.
He believes that he understands how
these vehicles operate, that
their operation is consistent, he thinks,
with his vision of what he calls Post Quantum
Physics. I have described it a bit
earlier in the previous monologue. It’s
really a way of looking at physics that’s
consistent with Einstein’s view of
a deterministic universe, a materialistic
universe in which
consciousness is an epiphenomenon.
He believes that that
is a worldview which will enable us to
understand
how it is possible that the UFOs
themselves are conscious.
Here is the interesting thing about
Jack’s claims.
As far as I know he has been very
vociferous in
saying that he knows how to build
these kinds of devices
along with conscious computers.
Everybody else that I know in the
physics community - and I have to preface
this by saying
I am no physicist. I haven’t taken
a single college course in physics. I’ve
gleaned what I’ve gleaned from the many
interviews I have done with people
in physics. But I have no claim to any
real technical knowledge
in physics. But the physicists I know who
interact with Jack - I’ve been on his
mailing list for years so
I get a lot of the correspondence - all
basically say his ideas are speculative
at best. They lack any kind of an
experimental support and if you push him
Jack will acknowledge that this is
true. He hopes to raise the money to do
the experiments which
I gather will be very sophisticated and expensive,
maybe amounting to hundreds of millions
of dollars
to really test his theories. But,
he argues that that kind of money should
be spent because of the potential threat
that these vehicles pose.
Conservative military analysis
suggests that
even though they haven’t indicated any
threat towards us, they appear to be
quite benign,
what if one of our enemies, what if
Russia or China
figured out how to build them? In fact,
Jack would be very happy to
share his knowledge with Russia or I
suppose with China, or Iran. He has already
indicated that he thinks that people in
those countries are very interested
in what he has to say.
Even though there is no indication of an
actual threat, certainly one has to be concerned
about a potential
threat because anyone who possesses
this kind of technology could clearly
overwhelm us.
There is also the
suggestion that this technology -
conscious computers -
has other military applications. The
very idea of Quantum Computers, which
is an idea that emerged actually,
according to
the historian David Kaiser, from some of
the thinking that Jack and his
colleagues - including some of my
friends like Nick Herbert and Saul-Paul
Sirag, were involved in in the 1970s - that
the present push for Quantum
Computers emerged out of their early
interest in Bell’s Theorem,
the EPR effect, Quantum Entanglement and
so on. I think it's a stretch. I think that
one of the reasons, personally,
that I’d be doubtful about the
theories that Jack is pushing is
because they are so
mainstream. They are based on a
materialistic
metaphysics. I’m inclined towards
the arguments of my friend
Bernardo Kastrup
who is definitely not a materialist.
That aside, the truth of the matter is we
just don’t know. Jack might
very well be correct in his
suppositions.
It's also worth talking about another
friend of mine, Hal
Puthoff, who worked closely with Russell
Targ at SRI,
and Ingo Swann, developing the original
remote viewing protocols.
After Hal left SRI
and put Ed May in charge of
the program - I might mention parenthetically
I suspect Ed May who is also a
physicalist would be favorably
inclined to Jack’s hypothesis
because it would be consistent with his
own metaphysics.
In any case, back to Hal Puthoff.
When he left SRI and the remote
viewing work
he moved to an institute in Austin,
Texas where he developed some very
advanced thinking about
Zero-point energy and its implications
for space travel.
Hal has been very interested in
UFO technology. It’s
quite interesting to me that some of the
leading physicists
thinking about space travel and UFO
technology are also people
seriously thinking about parapsychology.
Hal Puthoff certainly being one of them.
Jack Sarfatti, I guess you would have to
say, also another. I could add
additional names.
I want to say one more thing now about
Hal Puthoff
and that is he did give a talk in 2018
to a combined meeting of The International
Remote Viewing Association and The
Society for Scientific Exploration
in which he discussed the UFO material
and in particular material retrieved
possibly from a crash site.
He was very specific that somebody sent
an object decades ago to
Art Bell, the now deceased
radio talk show host. He used to have Coast
to Coast. I’ve been a guest on the show
a number of times. Apparently, it was
sent anonymously in the mail to Art Bell
from somebody
who simply said that he is a
former or current member of the military.
That this
object that was sent in came from a
UFO crash site of some kind.
Hal Puthoff described the object.
I have a feeling
this is the sort of thing that Leslie
Kean eluded to in the
interview that was released the day
before I release
this monologue. Here is the point.
The object was made out of alternating
layers of bismuth and magnesium.
The bismuth was as thick as a human hair.
The magnesium layers,
ten times the thickness of a human hair.
Hal Puthoff pointed out
there was no known source of
manufacturing such a
composite in the
world as we know. Furthermore, it would be
very, very difficult to manufacture
and furthermore at least back then
decades ago they didn’t
even know why anyone would. I’m pretty sure
that’s the object that Leslie also was
describing in that interview.
Subsequently, new developments
indicate that there could be some very
practical uses for this sort of thing. Jack
Sarfatti, in some of his writing, alludes
to the idea
that a substance like this might be
useful in creating space-time warps
of the sort that would be required for
the incredible maneuvers that these objects
observed in the year 2004 have shown.
Not to mention many, many other
observations of unidentified aerial
phenomenon.
Before I close let me just add that Jack
has recently commented on the
interview with Jason Reza Jorjani here
on the New Thinking Allowed channel
about time travel, which is completely
relevant to this discussion because
these UFOs may very well be
vehicles for the purpose of time travel.
The model of physics that Jack is
working with,
as conventional as it is in terms of
the materialist metaphysics, is one
that allows
for time travel. Time travel
or retrocausality is very important
in Jack’s own model
of consciousness itself.
In closing, let me say it does suggest
to me that some of the more extreme
views of time travel and their
military threats
as expressed in the Tom Cruise movie The
Edge of Tomorrow
with Emily Blunt, might be
an actual possibility, closer than we know.
That movie came out in 2014. Maybe
it was one of the reasons that
stimulated the imagination of astronaut
Charles Bolden
to suggest that we are about to be
invaded by
some entities with vastly superior
technological
capabilities. I am sharing all of this
with you now.
I certainly don’t wish for anybody to
become frightened or alarmed by these
prospects. I’m not. I don’t feel that
there is anything
really frightening here in spite of the
fear mongering
going on in some quarters. It does
raise the question of
whether we might be entering into a new
world with technological advances
happening
so vast in their significance and so
quickly
that we may all, within a few short years,
be thrust into a very, very different world.
I’ll leave you with those thoughts.
Thank you
for being with me.
[Music]
